item.title: Git Add Patch
item.description: It’s always fun when you find something entirely new, especially when it’s a quirk/feature on a tool that you use daily. This time around, I’ll be writing about git, in particular an option that you can use when stagging content for your next commit. Most of the times, I either use git add <file> or if I’m sure that every unstaged change should be stagged git add .. Today I found out the git add --patch, or git add -p for short.

item.title: Do Not Track - HTTP header
item.description: While I was setting up Google Analytics for this website, something that should be straightforward as Hugo already provides an internal template for this, I’ve noticed that my requests were not being tracked and displayed on the Google Analytics dashboard. I started by making sure that the internal template was actually being properly used and then, just in case, that the tracking id was correct. Both seemed to be ok.

I consider myself an eager to learn person, always with a learn-by-doing philosophy in mind. Other than that, I really like to feel challenged as it enables me to not only learn new things but also improve my problem solving skills. I truly believe that teaching is one of the best ways to learn, that’s why I’m currently mentoring csharp and python at exercism.
